Package UserCode.Movement

Interface IMovement

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    BubbleSwim, DiagonalSwim, HorizontalSwim, Sink
    public interface IMovement
    The IMovement instance provides functionality to allow objects to receive x and y cords for various movement patterns, receive notification if the fish hits a boundry and update the movement class with the x and y location of the method caller.
    Version:
    25/01/2019
    Author:
    Reid Giles

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      void initialise​(IDisplayObject pDisplayObject, double pX, double pY)
      METHOD: Initialise the behaviour with a relevant displayObject and coordinates
      void update()
      METHOD: Updates behaviour, driving object translation

    • Method Detail

      • update

        void update()
        METHOD: Updates behaviour, driving object translation

      • initialise

        void initialise​(IDisplayObject pDisplayObject,
                double pX,
                double pY)
        METHOD: Initialise the behaviour with a relevant displayObject and coordinates
        Parameters:
        pDisplayObject - Reference to the display object of the fish that should be controlled
        pX - Starting x cord of the fish that should be controlled
        pY - Starting y cord of the fish that should be controlled
